item.title: Heather add a quote by Dominique De Menil
item.description: "But nobody is visually naive any longer. We are cluttered with images, and only abstract art can bring us to the threshold of the divine." -- Dominique De Menil

item.title: Heather add a quote by Mark Rothko
item.description: "A picture lives by companionship, expanding and quickening in the eyes of the sensitive observer. It dies by the same token. It is therefore risky to send it out into the world. How often it must be impaired by the eyes of the unfeeling and the cruelty of the impotent." -- Mark Rothko

item.title: Heather add a quote by Dominique De Menil
item.description: "In a world filled with mistrust, armed to the teeth and ready to explode, a realistic attitude might be to consider love as an imperative need." -- Dominique De Menil

item.title: Heather add a quote by William Morris
item.description: "If you want a golden rule that will fit everything, this is it: Have nothing in your houses that you do not know to be useful or believe to be beautiful." -- William Morris

item.title: Heather add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Heather add a quote by Marcel Duchamp
item.description: "The creative act is not performed by the artist alone; the spectator brings the work in contact with the external world by deciphering and interpreting its inner qualifications and thus adds his contribution to the creative act." -- Marcel Duchamp

item.title: Heather add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Heather add a quote by Dominique De Menil
item.description: "God waits for us to create him." -- Dominique De Menil

item.title: Heather add a quote by Dominique De Menil
item.description: "We live in dramatic times. Violent confrontations are erupting in all parts of the world. Instinctively we feel that it does not have to be so. That confrontation could give way to cooperation." -- Dominique De Menil
